cluster_relations.rel_desc: Adult butterflies consume nectar as a food source.
The proboscis is used by butterflies to feed on nectar.
Nectar that butterflies feed on originates from flowers.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism consumes the object as a food resource.
args.justification: The relation describes adult butterflies consuming nectar as food; a feeding/consumption predicate from consumer (butterfly) to food resource (nectar) is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject structure is used as an instrument by the organism to feed on the object resource.
args.justification: The proboscis functions as an instrument to feed on nectar; the predicate should capture instrumental use specifically for feeding on the object.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject substance or product is generated or secreted by the object organism or structure.
args.justification: Nectar is secreted/generated by flowers; a production/provenance predicate from product (nectar) to producer (flowers) is the clearest and reusable formulation.
Both relations concern adult butterfly feeding biology: one links consumer to food resource, the other links a feeding structure to the resource it is used to exploit.
The relation connects a biological product (nectar) to its producing structure (flowers), fitting a general class for secretion/production relations.
Feeding is a trophic interaction between an organism and its food resource, best captured under an interaction-oriented group.
The proboscis is used as an instrument to obtain nectar, which is primarily a usage/instrumentality relation rather than direct interaction between two organisms or substances.
The origin of nectar from flowers reflects a production/provenance relationship where the presence of nectar is caused by floral secretion.
